name: src/index.js
OVApi
description:
This library can be used to access basic data from the OV-chipcard network in the Netherlands.
Author: Bart0110.

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of OVApi.

params.name: username
params.description: Username used to access ov-chipkaart.nl. This field is required.

params.name: password
params.description: Password used to access ov-chipkaart.nl. This field is required.

params.name: clientId
params.description: Special client identifier used to access ov-chipkaart.nl.

params.name: clientSecret
params.description: Special client secret bound to the client identifier.

name: _clientId
description: The client identifier.

name: _clientSecret
description: The client secret.

name: _username
description: The username.

name: _password
description: The password.

name: _loginToken
description: Token from logging into ov-chipkaart.nl. Note: this token is not authorized to do actions like fetching transactions.

name: _refreshToken
description: The refresh token is used to refresh the 'main' token for accesing ov-chipkaart.nl.

name: _dataToken
description: This token is authorized with the login token. This token is used to perform actions like fetching transactions.

name: _accessToken
description: As of now it does nothing. This is reserverd in case we need to use it.

name: _expireDate
description: At the moment the date the login token will expire.

name: _cards
description: This object holds all the attached cards to the account.

name: _loginEndpoint
description: Endpoint used to get an access token.

name: _actionEndpoint
description: Endpoint used to perform certain actions.

name: _oAuthRequest
description: Make a request to the oauth url

params.name: form
params.description: Parameters to pass to the url.

return.description: Resolve returns token used to create data token. Reject contains an error message that occurred.

name: _login
description: Login into ov-chipkaart.nl.

return.description: Resolve returns token used to create data token. Reject returns an error message that occurred while logging in.

name: authorize
description: Create data token. This method automatically logs you in if you haven't called _login()

return.description: Resolve returns token used to access data. Reject returns an error message that occurred while fetching the token.

name: _checkToken
description: Check if token is expired, if so the function re-authorize the tokens.

return.description: Resolve returns token used to access data. Reject returns an error message that occurred while fetching the token.

name: _tlsRequest
description: Make a request to the tls API

params.name: endpoint
params.description: API endpoint to call. This field is required.

return.description: Resolve returns api response. Reject contains an error message if the API returned a failure or the API request failed.

name: getCards
description: Get all attached cards to the account.

return.description: Resolve returns all cards attached to the account. Reject returns an error message that occurred while fetching the cards.

name: getTransactionsNRC
description: Get transactions with optional parameters.

params.name: mediumId
params.description: Unique card id. You can pull this from getCards(). This field is required.

params.name: nrc
params.description: the 'nextRequestContext' used to get more data.

return.description: Resolve returns transactions. Reject returns an error message that occurred while fetching the transactions.

name: getTransactions
description: Get transactions between two dates.

params.name: mediumId
params.description: Unique card id. You can pull this from getCards(). This field is required.

params.name: startDate
params.description: The date were the server should start looking. Correct syntax = `YYYY-MM-DD`.

params.name: endDate
params.description: The date were the server should stop looking. Correct syntax = `YYYY-MM-DD`.

params.name: offset
params.description: How many records the server should skip.

return.description: Resolve returns transactions. Reject returns an error message that occurred while fetching the transactions.

name: getTransactionsYear
description: Get all the transactions for the specified year. When you don't specify the year it returns all the records from last year.

params.name: mediumId
params.description: Unique card id. You can pull this from getCards(). This field is required.

params.name: year
params.description: What year should we look into.

params.name: delay
params.description: The delay between requests in milliseconds.

return.description: Resolve returns records from the specified year. Reject returns an error message that occurred while fetching the transactions.

name: getDetailedCardInfo
description:
Get detailed card info such as balance, when the balance was last updated, auto reload information (automatic balance upgrade)
and the date when the card expires.

params.name: mediumId
params.description: Unique card id. You can pull this from getCards(). This field is required.

return.description: Resolve returns detailed information about the card. Reject returns an error message that occurred while fetching the transactions.

name: src/throw-if-missing.js

content:
# OVApi
[![document](https://ovchip.github.io/ovchipapi-node/badge.svg)](https://ovchip.github.io/ovchipapi-node)

This is a NodeJS API wrapper to make it easy to connect to the Dutch OV Chipkaart API. 
You can use this wrapper to fetch:
- Your balance
- Cards
- Detailed card information
- Check-in location
- Check-out location

### Install:
First run ```npm install --save ovchip-api```

Than add ```import OVApi from 'ovchip-api'``` 

### Examples:
```javascript
import OVApi from 'ovchip-api';

let instance = new OVApi(username, password);

instance.authorize()
    .then(instance.getCards)
    .then((results) => {
      //Display all the transaction today
      instance.getTransactions(results[0]['mediumId']).then(console.log).catch(console.error);
    
      //Display detailed card information
      instance.getDetailedCardInfo(results[0]['mediumId']).then(console.log).catch(console.error);
}).catch(console.error);
```

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This project and the distribution of this project is not illegal, nor does it violate _any_ DMCA laws. 
The use of this project, however, may be illegal. 
The maintainers of this project do not condone the use of this project for anything illegal, in any state, region, country, or planet. 
_Please use at your own risk_.**

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
